results.title: Accelerating the seventies
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films and Fred A Niles Communications Centre
results.brief_description: A visual description of the progress and potential problems of the rapid advancements of the 1970’s. Using rapid-fire cutting techniques the sense of pace of unchecked growth and its potential is transmitted to the viewer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sterling Educational Films and Fred A Niles Communications Centre

results.title: Accattone
results.creator_credit: Arco Films (US), Cino Del Duca, Alfredo Bini and Pier Pasolini
results.brief_description: Pasolini’s directorial debut is a powerful neo-realist film about the activities of slum-dwellers in post war Rome. Accatone is a young pimp who lives off the earnings of his young “girl.” When she is imprisoned, he meets the virginal Stella but their attempts to escape the harsh existence of poverty and prostitution prove fruitless in a world of relentless economic and social exploitation. Pasolini used non-professional actors recruited from the Roman slums to play the lead roles, including a young Franco Citti in the role of Accatone. Though firmly influenced by the aesthetics of neo-realism, the film frames the proletariat characters in a fatalistic and stylised milieu which prefigures the radical mannerist cinema Pasolini was to create in the late sixties. On its release “Accatone” was to prove controversial with moralists of both the left and right and was the beginning of Pasolini’s battles with international censors. Bernardo Bertolucci was assistant director on the film. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Abstraction
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated, ACI Films and American Federation of Arts
results.brief_description: Shows that abstraction is an essential aspect of daily living. Uses a variety of examples to establish a definition of abstraction and to illustrate how the artist employs it when selecting what is visually and emotionally significant in the creation of their work.

results.title: Abstract in concrete (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Arvonio Productions and John Arvonio
results.brief_description: An experimental film produced by photographing neon signs in the wet pavements of Times Square New York. This unusual film was painstakingly photographed on rainy nights, under difficult conditions, over a period of five years. The producer has discovered, and recorded, a wealth of visual beauty in the patterns and movements of the constantly changing light reflections.

results.title: Abstract designs from nature with Edward Betts
results.brief_description: Observes Edward Betts as he makes several pencil drawings at a quarry. Shows how he develops one of his drawings into a watercolour in his studio.

results.title: Absolution
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Tor Larson and Andrew Lawrence
results.brief_description: A questioning of religious beliefs and values as seen through the eyes of 11-year-old Malcolm, an altar boy. Malcolm lives with his mother and younger brother in a caravan and earns himself a bit of pocket money by doing jobs and helping out his elderly neighbour, Poppy. When Poppy suffers a stroke, Malcolm is faced with the dubious motives of his own mother and Poppy’s son Charles who is trying to find the Deed Box containing Poppy’s family papers and documents. Malcolm’s ultimate intervention achieves a kind of absolution for them all. Cast includes Malcolm Roberts (as Malcolm), Kim Dawson, Edward Primrose, Cathleen Cooper, Eli Roberts.

results.title: Absolute power
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, Malpaso Company, Clint Eastwood and Karen Spiegel
results.brief_description: Absolute Power is a political thriller about a retiring thief who witnesses a murder - by the President of the United States. Fearing that he will be blamed, the thief plans to flee the country - after making amends with his estranged daughter - but decides instead to stay and fight the hypocrisy. Masterfully directed (and starring) Clint Eastwood, this paranoid conspiracy crime story bristles with suspense and features an all impressive cast that includes Gene Hackman, Ed Harris, Laura Linney, Scott Glenn, Dennis Haysbert, E.G. Marshall and Judy Davis.

results.title: Absolute beginners
results.creator_credit: Palace Pictures, Virgin Films, Goldcrest Films, Stephen Woolley, Chris Brown and Julien Temple
results.brief_description: Set in London in 1958, this unconventional rock musical is based on Colin MacInnes’ cult novel about emerging teen culture and racial tension in London circa 1958. Told from the perspective of eighteen year old Colin, a budding photographer and jazz fan, the film takes the viewer on a nostalgic, stylised trip into the social and cultural milieu of Soho and Notting Hill. The story revolves around Colin’s thwarted relationship with Suzette, who works for a chic couturier in Mayfair. Inspired by the artifice of Classic Hollywood musicals, director Julien Temple, who had previously made a name filming rock videos, gives this genre a visually inventive and energetic twist. The film features an impressive one-take opening sequence a la ‘Touch of Evil’, a string of dazzling production numbers set to a jazz inflected score by Gil Evans and a cast that includes David Bowie, Sade, Ray Davies, James Fox and Patsy Kensit.

results.title: Abseiling
results.brief_description: An instructional film on abseiling techniques. Shows how to set up a classic abseil and a standard abseil and illustrates methods of rope control and descent. Presupposes a knowledge of preparatory techniques. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
